som.config

Class ConfigFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • som.config.ConfigFile

  • public class ConfigFile
extends java.lang.Object

    This class reads one or more text files to generate name-value pairs that can be used to load constants or initial values of other classes. The file(s) is opened only during the construction of the object, and when reload() is called. Otherwise, other functions return values that were read when the file(s) was opened.

    The text file should have the following format:
    name1 = value1
    name2 = value2
    Names and values are stored as strings until another function is called to process the value, e.g., getInt()

    Comments in the text file should use the # character, e.g.,
    # This is a valid comment
    name1 = value1 # this is a valid comment too

    To read other files as input, use the ~INCLUDE command, e.g.
    ~INCLUDE other_file.txt
    This will cause the ConfigFile class to load "other_file.txt" and process it as well.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigFile

        public ConfigFile(java.lang.String path,
                  java.lang.String filename)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a ConfigFile by reading the specified file.
        Parameters:
        path - root directory to search for files
        filename - name of the file to read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs while reading the file

    • Method Detail

      • getBool

        public boolean getBool(java.lang.String name,
                       boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then the default value is returned. This function assumes that 0 means false, and any other integer means true.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value (0 or 1) in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value as a bool

      • getCentimetersFromMeters

        public double getCentimetersFromMeters(java.lang.String name,
                                       double defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then the default value is returned. This function assumes that the value in the file(s) is in meters, and will convert it to centimeters.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value (in meters) in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value (in centimeters) as a double

      • getDouble

        public double getDouble(java.lang.String name,
                        double defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then the default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value as a double

        Parameters:

        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value as an integer

      • getMetersFromCentimeters

        public double getMetersFromCentimeters(java.lang.String name,
                                       double defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then the default value is returned. This function assumes that the value in the file(s) is in centimeters, and will convert it to meters.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value (in centimeters) in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value (in meters) as a double

      • getMillisecondsFromSeconds

        public int getMillisecondsFromSeconds(java.lang.String name,
                                      int defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then the default value is returned. This function assumes that the value in the file(s) is in seconds, and will convert it to milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value (in seconds) in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value (milliseconds) as a long

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns the path associated with the name. The value is read from the file, and pre-pended by the path defined in the config file. For example, if the path is /home/nao and the value in the file is a.txt, then getPath will return /home/nao/a.txt
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to use as the filename
        Returns:
        path as a string

      • getRadiansFromDegrees

        public double getRadiansFromDegrees(java.lang.String name,
                                    double defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then the default value is returned. This function assumes that the value in the file(s) is in degrees, and will convert it to radians.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value (in degrees) in the file(s)
        defaultValue - default value to be returned if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value (in radians) as a double

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns the value associated with the name. If the name does not exist in the files, then an empty string is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the value in the file(s)
        defaultValue - the default value to use if name does not exist
        Returns:
        value as a string

        public void reload()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Reloads the file, and all included files (if any).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
